headerDisplay: Homebridge plugin that exposes a radio button selection with dummy switches.
footerDisplay: Each radio group can have several switches, only one switch can be enabled at a time. If a switched is turned ON, all other switches are turned OFF.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the group, that is initially used as the display name.

displayAsPowerStrip.title: Display As Power Strip
displayAsPowerStrip.description: If enabled, outlets instead of switches are exposed to HomeKit. This provides a more compact UI in the Apple Home app.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the switch. Should be unique within the group.

isDefaultOn.title: Is Default On
isDefaultOn.description: A single switch in a group can be defined as the 'default on'. If a switch in a group has this property enabled, the group acts as a radio button group that always has one option 'selected'. This means if all switches are set to OFF, the switch that is marked as 'default on' is set to ON.

nextOnSwitchName.title: Next On Switch
nextOnSwitchName.description: The name of the switch (in the same group) that should be switched to ON if the current switch is switched OFF. This overwrites the 'default on' behavior.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: If a value is set (in seconds), a timer is started when the 'selection' changes. When the timer elapses, the 'selection' is reset to the button that is marked as default on. If no default on button is provided, all are switched off.

isRadio.title: Is Radio Switch
isRadio.description: To indicate if this switch is part of the radio switch group. Default is YES. Set to NO to allow the switch stay ON/OFF independently

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: If a value is set (in seconds), a timer is started when the 'selection' changes. When the timer elapses, the 'selection' is reset to the button that is marked as default on. If no default on button is provided, all are switched off.
